items.q: In 'The Lord of the Rings', what type of creature is Frodo Baggins?
items.explanation: Hobbits are small, peace-loving creatures known for their furry feet and love of food.

items.q: Mickey Mouse's original name was Mortimer Mouse.
items.explanation: Walt Disney's wife Lillian suggested the name change from Mortimer to Mickey.

items.q: The iconic phrase 'Beam me up, Scotty' was said in every episode of the original Star Trek series.
items.explanation: Interestingly, Captain Kirk never actually said the exact phrase 'Beam me up, Scotty' in the original series.

items.q: What is the name of the massive, cinematic universe created by Marvel Studios?
items.explanation: It started with 'Iron Man' in 2008 and spans dozens of interconnected films and shows.

items.q: Which artist is famous for the hit single 'Bad Romance' and her meat dress at the VMAs?
items.explanation: Her dramatic fashion and theatrical performances define her pop persona.

items.q: What animated underwater town does SpongeBob SquarePants live in?
items.explanation: He lives there in a pineapple with his pet snail, Gary.

items.q: What is the highest-grossing film of all time (unadjusted for inflation)?
items.explanation: Directed by James Cameron, its groundbreaking 3D technology drove massive box office returns.

items.q: In the 'Harry Potter' universe, what is the sport played on flying broomsticks?
items.explanation: It involves chasing a Golden Snitch and throwing Quaffles through hoops.

items.q: Who played Jack Dawson in the 1997 blockbuster movie 'Titanic'?
items.explanation: The role catapulted him to international superstardom.

items.q: What legendary British spy is famously known by his code number, 007?
items.explanation: Created by Ian Fleming, he works for MI6.
